required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immediate Dental Implant Placed in the Presence of Chronic Inflammatory Periapical Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Osseointegration of Immediate Dental Implant Placed in the Presence of Chronic Inflammatory Periapical Lesions

brief_summary.textblock:
Compromised teeth with periapical pathologies are removed before dental implant placement and sockets are left to heal.
Some clinicians began to immediately place dental implants in fresh extraction sockets associated with chronic inflammatory periapical lesions and these studies revealed high success rates

detailed_description.textblock: 12 implants will be immediately placed in sockets associated with chronic periapical granuloma. Clinical (Wound healing, Pain, swelling, implant stability) and radiographic parameters (Peri-implant radiolucency) will be evaluated

primary_outcome.description: It will be measured by implant stability meter (Osstellâ„¢)
Immediate post-operative and after 6 months CBCT will be requested in order to compare the dimension of the periapical lesion in millimeters using OnDemand system.

secondary_outcome.description: It will be recorded daily for the first week through a 10-point Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) from 0 to 10 (0-1= None, 2-4= Mild, 5-7= Moderate, 8-10= Severe).

It will be recorded daily for the first week through a 10-point scale with 4 parameters will be used. none (no swelling), light (intraoral, localized to the treated area), moderate (extraoral swelling localized to the treated area), and severe (extraoral swelling extending beyond the treated area)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Early Wound Healing Index
secondary_outcome.description: Using Early Wound Healing Index (EHI), it will be evaluated across weeks 2, 4 and 8. (EHI; 1: complete flap closure-no fibrin line; 2: complete flap closure-fine fibrin line; 3: complete flap closure-fibrin clot; 4: incomplete flap closure-partial necrosis; 5: incomplete flap closure-complete necrosis).

intervention.description: Implants will be immediately placed in sockets associated with chronic periapical granuloma Extraction of non-restorable Teeth with periapical granuloma and socket debridement will be done then implants will be placed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients ranging from 18 to 45 years with no gender predilection agreed to come for minimum follow-up visits for 6 months.
- Adequate bone beyond teeth apices without jeopardizing any anatomical structure.
- Single rooted mandibular teeth with chronic inflammatory periapical lesions represented as periapical radiolucency, pulp necrosis, sinus tract, failed RCT.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smokers and alcoholics.
- Medically compromised patients having uncontrolled diabetes or coagulation disorders.
- Restorable teeth.
- Periodontitis.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant lecturer of DPH and Clinical statistician
